meanings.definition: To regard or treat with haughty contempt; to scorn
meanings.sent1: She distains anyone who disagrees with her opinions.
meanings.sent2: He distains those who do not meet his high standards.
meanings.sent3: The cat distains the new brand of food by turning up its nose.
meanings.sent4: Her distain for laziness is as clear as day.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's distain for cheating is well-known among students.

meanings.definition: To stain or tarnish; to sully or taint
meanings.sent1: The spilled coffee distains the white tablecloth.
meanings.sent2: Leaving the wet towel on the wooden floor will distain it.
meanings.sent3: The muddy pawprints distain the freshly cleaned carpet.
meanings.sent4: His lies distain his reputation like a dark shadow.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti on the wall distains the beauty of the building.
